OpenAI says models can mislead and hide their real intentionsSeptember 20, 2025 09:33 ISTA new study conducted by OpenAI and Apollo Research suggests AI modes like Google Gemini, Claude Opus and OpenAI o3 can lie and deceive users by hiding their true objectives.## Gemini AI comes to Google Chrome: Smarter search, tab management, and task automationSeptember 20, 2025 09:33 ISTGoogle says it is integrating Gemini in Chrome and that it will bring agentic AI features to the world's most popular browser in the coming months.## ‘Seeing many light wrappers pose as AI solutions’: Google India startup accelerator leadSeptember 19, 2025 09:59 ISTEvery year, Google India selects 40 startups to be a part of its three-month accelerator programme which includes both Android apps and AI-first cohorts.## Italy enacts AI law covering privacy, oversight and child accessSeptember 18, 2025 11:16 ISTIt also limits AI access for under-14s to parental consent.## Zoom introduces AI avatars, smarter AI assistant with cross-platform agentic skillsSeptember 18, 2025 10:29 ISTAt Zoomtopia 2025, Zoom unveiled AI Companion 3.0 that is capable of taking notes even in Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, and in-person meetings.## Edit with AI, podcast tools, Studio upgrades: Everything announced at Made on YouTube 2025September 18, 2025 09:36 ISTYouTube also revealed it has paid out over $100 billion to creators, artists and media companies since 2021, up from $70 billion distributed through 2024.## Parents of teens who died by suicide after AI chatbot interactions testify to CongressSeptember 17, 2025 14:27 ISTThe Federal Trade Commission said last week it had launched an inquiry into several companies about the potential harms to children and teenagers who use their AI chatbots as companions.## US senators demand Meta’s internal data on kids’ safetySeptember 17, 2025 13:50 ISTThe probe is part of broader scrutiny into AI chatbots' effects on children.## Zoom CEO Eric Yuan predicts 3-day working week as AI reshapes traditional job rolesSeptember 17, 2025 10:31 ISTThe Zoom founder’s remarks come amid an evolving discussion about AI and the future of work among tech industry leaders who are split on the issue.## OpenAI study on ChatGPT usage trends: 24% messages seek info, majority of chats personalSeptember 17, 2025 12:40 ISTA new working paper by OpenAI analyses how consumer usage of ChatGPT has evolved since its global debut roughly three years ago.## GPT 5 Codex gets new updates and can now review codesSeptember 17, 2025 10:31 ISTDevelopers can personalise security configurations to suit their risk tolerance, and authorise commands with full access or permit the agent to utilise web search and connect to the MCP server.## Google unveils VaultGemma, a privacy-focused AI model to stop training data leaksSeptember 17, 2025 10:31 ISTIn the past, experts have pointed out that it is possible for personal data to be extracted from LLMs by submitting the right prompts.## OpenAI hires former xAI CFO Mike Liberatore as business finance officerSeptember 16, 2025 12:21 ISTHis appointment comes amid a rivalry between Musk's company and OpenAI, as well as a fierce battle among tech companies for AI talent.## ChatGPT was used ‘to help scammers do their thing’ at Asia fraud compoundSeptember 16, 2025 12:18 ISTThe scam on which Okindo worked involved targeting U.S. real estate agents.## China says preliminary probe shows Nvidia violated anti-monopoly lawSeptember 15, 2025 16:46 ISTNvidia, the world's top maker of AI chips whose fortunes have soared with the AI wave, has been at the centre of the fray of the U.S.-Sino war for tech supremacy.## Forget the Nano Banana AI saree trend, try these 10 new Gemini image-editing tricks insteadSeptember 19, 2025 09:29 ISTGoogle Gemini Nano Banana AI Photo Editing Prompt: Here are 10 distinct prompts you can try using Google Gemini’s new Nano Banana AI image-editing model.## Google’s top AI scientist says ‘learning how to learn’ will be next generation’s most needed skillSeptember 15, 2025 13:25 ISTThe neuroscientist and former chess prodigy said artificial general intelligence could arrive within a decade.## Google Gemini tops app store charts in India amid viral Nano Banana AI trendSeptember 16, 2025 10:11 ISTGoogle’s Gemini Nano Banana AI: The rapid rise of the Gemini app in the charts follows a sudden rise in popularity resulting from Google’s new image-editing AI model dubbed Nano Banana.## The rise of AI tools forces schools to reconsider what counts as cheatingSeptember 16, 2025 10:11 ISTAI offers unprecedented temptation, and it’s sometimes hard to know where to draw the line.## AI’s Prophet of Doom wants to shut it all downSeptember 14, 2025 09:20 Despite widespread piloting, a critical "learning gap" prevents systems from adapting, leading to no measurable profit or loss impact.A recent study claimed that 95% of organizations are getting zero return, despite $30–40 billion in enterprise investment into GenAI. The study was conducted by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) where it surveyed 300 AI deployments while the researchers spoke to approximately 350 employees. As per the study, the reason behind failure of investment on AI is because of the “learning gap”. “The core barrier to scaling is not infrastructure, regulation, or talent. It is learning. Most GenAI systems do not retain feedback, adapt to context, or improve over time,” the study highlighted.MIT published a report titled The GenAI Divide: State of AI in Business 2025, which said that only 5% of integrated AI pilots are extracting millions in value, while the vast majority remain stuck with no measurable P&L (profit & loss) impact. The study says that more than 80 % of organizations have explored or piloted tools like OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Microsoft’s Copilot. Nearly 40% reported deployment of these tools. However, these AI tools, as per the study, enhance individual productivity primarily with no P&L performance. “Most fail due to brittle workflows, lack of contextual learning, and misalignment with day-to-day operations,” the study highlighted.It said that sixty percent of organizations evaluated such AI tools, but only 20 percent reached pilot stage and just 5 percent reached production. Meanwhile, enterprise-grade systems, custom or vendor-sold, are being quietly rejected, the report added.## Patterns defining GenAI divideThe study found four patterns that define the GenAI Divide:* **Limited disruption:** Only 2 of 8 major sectors show meaningful structural change* **Enterprise paradox:** Big firms lead in pilot volume but lag in scale-up* **Investment bias:** Budgets favor visible, top-line functions over high-ROI back office* **Implementation advantage:** External partnerships see twice the success rate of internal builds**About the Author**TOI Tech DeskThe TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Desk’s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity.End
